comments.text: Our friend droped us (2girls) to this spot. We were staying in 200-300 m before tollboots with Budapest signed. A car stoped and pick up us to Zagreb to the next tollbooth )) we were waiting 20-30 min in a raining)

Great spots with four lanes full of rides to choose from. It's a bit tricky to get there though. An option that worked for us was to take the bus number 12 from the Delta bus lot to a small town called Cavle. From there we took the bus number 15A that dropped us off near the tollbooths. The bus has a long route before it arrives at your stop so you will have to go with it for half an hour or so. Just make sure to ask him to drop you off near the tollbooths, he will know.
Really easy spot ! :)
HH here for 5 min in direction Zagreb.No problems again.
Again no problems in direction Zagreb

Tuesday 1pm, waited 2 min and get a ride to 15 km before Split. ( tried from Arena center in Zagreb before, hard to get a ride, even to Lucko ). ZE-TRA truck's driver are amazing! If Zvonimir pick you up, just enjoy eheh

12/15
Arrived there at 8PM and waited (literary stayed at the place all the time) until... 9AM. Yes, I am stubborn as hell. Almost freeze but finally got a direct ride to Zadar. 

There is some traffic all night but people don't stop. (especially in winter). 

Don't worry about police. They stopped me before and told about this spot saying that "they will pretend to not see me". So just behave nicely and they should be fine, they even controlled cars when I was hitch-hiking.
We were two guys with huge backpacks and a "ZD" sign, and we got a ride to Zadar in about half an hour or so. The driver was drinking beer by the wheel, but it was cool nevertheless :)
We waited there 20 minutes, we were very lucky, as other people seems to wait there longer than us (boy/girl). Good that cars are staying in queue.
Had a huge sign "MARIBOR" but it didn't work very well. Then we stopped a car directly at the pay toll booth with a Czech flag (to Brno).
Good spot with enough traffic for both ways, got a ride to Belgrade after an hour.

10min direction to Zagreb, we were really lucky!

DON'T BE SURPRISED IF POLICE WILL COME TO YOU AND ASK FOR YOUR PASSPORT, THEY WILL JUST CHECK AND SAY GOOD LUCK
15 mins for a lift to belgrade
a big gas station that works both ways
When a serbian truck driver saw me hitching, he invited me to ride with him. He was nice, but had a very interesting Taste in music And absolutely destroyed my eardrums

Very good spot direction ZAGREB or even for south [Split]. You can walk here from Rijeka - it will be around 2 hours of trip but it worths because the small Croatian villages are really nice looking! Or you can take bus number 12 from Rijeka bus station Delta until the village Cevla. Then follow direction East and find the highpass which takes you to this petrol station! A Croatian truck driver took me to Zagreb after 30 minutes waiting time!

Good spot to go to slavonski brod.
After few minutes we talked with to serbian guys who took us to slawonski brod .
Gas station, direction bosnian border (Gradi≈°ka/ Slavonski Brod). We got a ride to Bosnian Gradi≈°ka in about 1h on Sunday afternoon (by asking people directly at the gas station).
The guy offered a ride to mostar in bosnia but we stopped in Dubrovnik
Got a ride to Bosnia with a sign at 9pm during dark. Plenty of space for drivers to see and stop.

English below

Nous arrivons depuis Split et allons √† Mostar
Deux personnes (homme et femme)
Conducteur nous a d√©pos√© sur ce spot. Nous a conseill√© de prendre la route Grude / ≈†iroki pour aller √† Mostar.
Un policier nous a pris pour nous emmener √† la fronti√®re.
Petite bi√®re sympa √† prendre en attendant

Aurel, ao√ªt 2023 - 10min

We are arriving from Split and going to Mostar
Two people (man and woman)
Driver dropped us off at this spot.  Advised us to take the Grude/≈†iroki road to Mo
Got picked up immediately and taken one village further by a local.
Amazing spot lots of space for car to stop and also petrol station for you to ask people! We've got picked up by a nice woman direction Zadar
Great spot! We got a ride to Slunj after about 20 min. We were four!
Wur nahmen Zug und einen Bus [cheap] (50 cent) <raper lul xd>! dann 20 minuten mit schild warten [l√§cheln]üòÑüòÅüòÉüòÄ! einsteigen und mitfahren small (pp) talk! sehr gut bis "karlobag".
Good spot next to the roundabout direction  KRAS and VRBNIK. I guy took me directly to Vrbnik with his 27 years old Renault, it was an epic ride! :))
seems to be a nice "official hitchhiking spot" :)
A lot of space for cars, everybody drives slowly, good spot for people who want to go to Poland

Ploce-Mostar: Got a ride leaving a ferry from Trapanj. I added this because of those going to Bosnia, this may be a good place to catch a ride. I looked out for BiH license plate, found a girl, asked her if she was going to Mostar and took me. We stopped at Medugorje too :) Give it a shot.

Orebic to Trapanj: Not a very safe place to HH but since it's light with traffic flow is ok. Stood somewhat behind a guardrail en route to Trapanj to catch a ferry. Wait time 5 ish minutes. Very good HH experience with a friendly Croatian.
Best place ever. Hitchiked there for few times and got piced up immediately.

Way to Svete Jure or Makarska.
Entrance of National Park. 
Pay your entrance feee and wait for people who go up the 23km road to Svete Jure.
Or ask people to take you down to Makarska
Easy for getting to Rovinj, and probably also to Pula
Good to get car to coastline
A bus hitchhiking spot for all of you who are going to NoviGrad and on.
Hitching on the ferry is quite possible, but you have to pay your own ticket (18 kuna = 4 euros). while on the ferry, try to get rides for further on.

On the ferry from Brestova, towards Cres town.

When on the ferry, make a sign for Cres (town) and go stand at the front. People on the boat will see you and you'll most probably have a ride before the cars even start driving off.

Longer distance (to Losinj island) should be possible, much traffic is headed there.

It is just in front of a Tommy supermarket and in 5 minutes a couple of french guys picked us up :-) 
Cars come a little bit fast but they actually have time to stop.
Klis-Split direction. There is a place near local bar. We just entered to ask about bus schedule, and then one guy (bar loyal customer!) offered us a ride to Split (where we were heading).

Great spot, large motel, petrol station and parking lot. A lot of cars heading to Maribor, Graz, Vienna, Linz, Germany and Italy. We were a little bit unlucky because Easter holiday was just finishing and 90 % of cars were totally full. Anyway we got a ride straight to Graz. However, it is quite long walk from Zagreb centre.
Towards Karlovac, 2 cars stoped for us here in less then 5min

This place is very good if you want to SRB or BiH but not for SLO. You must ask drivers there, there are waiting for a clearance but it is possible to wait more then 2 hours. Don't worry to go to the clearance place behind the gate/barrier crossing!!!

It's hard to get to this place if you're on foot, but when you get to the toll, it's easy to hitch a ride if you're going to the west (Zagreb). There are a lot of people going to Zagreb since it's the capital city. I waited for 15 minutes around 8 AM when the traffic was really sparse, but it was enough.

Direction: from Velika Gorica to Sisak

You could get transport directly to Sisak, workers, students, delivery cars passing by.

This is motorway going out of Velika Gorica, it is much better to use this motorway than the new highway (which is not completely finished yet)
normaly there should be a trafic circle. but anyway in this area i made the expierience that it's easy to hitchhike from busstations...
a good place, with a very small, sweet gas station, small traffic but i was pickt up after √Ö¬• minutes

you can hitchhike from here up to mount SLJEME, to the television tower, the ski area, the restaurants and the hotels. there is always cars that bring guests to the hotels on top of the mountain or wanderers in their cars. the national park authority took me up in their jeep in march 2010 after a 10 minutes waiting time. the road is a one way lane, the way down from mount sljeme into the zagreb basin is 5 kilometers westward (a one way road as well).
the way to ZAGREB from mount SLJEME: from here you can easiely catch cars going down into the ZAGREB basin. the road is a one way lane.
possible long distance
long distance
Got a ride from a truck driver just needed to ask. There are a lot of traffic here
Good spot in you are heading to the Slovenian coast
Easy spot towards north, sped limit 50km/h, cars go slow
Local dropped us in Cavtat

That's very good spot to Trebinje. About 3-5pm there is a lot of people going back from work in Dubrovnik. This spot is also used by locals, there was like 4 guys hitchhiking, so I went down to Kaufland for some shopping, when I came back there were gone and I get a ride in about 10min. To get there I walked from Dubrovnik old town, there is an old road between the sea and main road. Quite long uphill walk, but views are amazing and spot for hitchhiking is worth it also.
Not to much traffic but enough on a Friday morning. Won‚Äôt make it far but was very easy to get a ride to the toll booth. Trying to go to dubrovnik
Quickly got direct ride to Zagrzeb

A lot of friendly people. Met a really nice guy. Ended up staying a night with him. 
(Askes around at the supermarket parking lot)

Dangerous road ! 
But realy good for hitchhike with a good place for stop.
Car speed but ok !

Goal: Dubrovnik
A super nice Herznegovian guy took us to Seum after only 5min. Lots of traffic, not the best spot for the cars to stop though.
(direction ferry back to mainland) guy picked me up in less than a minute and drove me all the way to the ferry
Good spot, lots of cars stop on their way to Split. A guy saw us getting off the car with our sign in hand and went to talk to us ;) that's luck
There is some space for cars to stop. After 20 min with sign "Split" we got a ride with hungarian turists.

This is NOT a hitchhiking spot. It's a nice cove to sleep on. 

Walk along the coastal path past Pla≈æa ƒåri≈°njeva. I past a few cabins. One looked like it could be slept in but I chose not to. I carried on and then saw a rocky beach. People on boats can see you so don't set up canp until it's dark!

Nice spot. There is a place for cars stop as they ride through gas station. Longer wait time; people going to nearby villages north short distance,  or due to a lot of tourism and people having full cars.
Really nice spot if you want go to the Split, Zadar or ≈†ibenik
Perfect spot with shade and area where cars need to slow down

Great spot! Many cars going in both directions. There's the small gas station if you need to buy smth and a bench in the shade. Then we just sat on the bench eating our snacks and the cars stopped next to us to get something from the gas station so we could easily ask from them for a ride. We got a ride to Senj from a Slovenian man!
As a local I recommend this place, you won't wait longer than 15 minutes. Most people go to Benkovac (small town)
Good spot to cross the border to Metlika
Great spot, you catch cars going north in two directions. Got a ride to zadar in about 45min

Wonderful spot (even has a good view). Cars slow down because of the curve and there is ample space for people to stop at the rest area. I went direction Rijeka and got a ride at 9am signaling with the thumb
Got a ride to delnice in 5 minutes on my way to risnjiek national park. People go south, some on road trips to croatian seaside.

We got so lucky there! That's the spot you should stand on after crossing the border, because people go slow on the roundabout and they have some time to stop. We stood with a sign Osijek and litterally the first guy stopped and took us just before it started raining heavily
At bus station its nice, cars can see you ale there is a place to stop

This was a good place to stay. There was a shadow, conteiner with a lot of cardboard that could be used for your final destination, free toilets. People were mostly from Croatia, but also a lot from Austria, Czech and Hungary. :) Young lady came to us after about one hour that She goes to our destination. :)
Asked a British couple as they were leaving the beach for a ride to the next town to catch a bus. Very friendly.
good spot, you can try to get a ride anywhere on this road because its not that busy, we stood with a sign
A man on a old car took me to Rijeka, so long ride. Lot of cars were passing there on Sunday evening.
I was walking towards the bigger road and tried to hitchhike along the way with a sign "Split" it worked and I wasn't even trying too hard! :))
Lot of people going to Montenegro, Budva should be a good sign. We got a ride to kotor quickly, and the bus stop is good for pulling over
Good spot right at the bus station. Not so much traffic but there also seems to be a not very regular bus to the border.

The bus station is a very nice spot with lots of space to pull over. There is a supermarket right on the opposite site of the bus station, from where the Promet Makarska bus line goes south to at least Ploƒçe
Stood right in front of the T-intersection. A good amount of traffic. Got picked up and invited to lunch by a nice lady.
Good spot for cars to pull over and see you if you stand a good bit behind the roundabout. Not that much traffic.
The very first car that came right after I crossed the road stopped.
At the bus stop! we got an immediate ride to Rovinj for 4 people!
We are waiting for a little bit more than 1 hour. We hitched with a thumb and then with a sing in a hand.
Fast way to Zadar
The third car stoped, couple of young poles took us to Orebiƒá. Not a bad place - low traffic, car can stop on the crossroad. Good experience. But probably depends a lot on your luck
We were super lucky, tried to hitchhike while walking and got a ride direclty to port to take the ferry. Good spot probably to get into Zadar.

There is a bus station where you can stand. Good spot to travel into Zadar, because the street goes directly into city center. Waited about 10-15 min. Only good spot to go into city, not possible for anything else.
Great spot to go to Split, police came but only to check my ID. Waited 30min and got a direct ride to Split (solo male backpacker, sign "Split")
Two hitchhikers (boys) and we waited less than 5 minutes before getting picked up by a caravan. Lots of space to be seen and for cars to stop, highly recomend
Stood near the bins behind the church. A man from Trsteno eventually took us (two guys) to Dubrovnik after 25 minutes. Good stopping spot cos everyone going south passes on this road!

good traffick and slow speed and has busstop for cars to stop. stranded there with sign to Italy or Austria as there are many german and austrian cars. Unfortunately nobody seemed to be interested and locals flipped me off. Changed sign to Rijeka and took me around 50min to be picked up

3rd car I asked took me to the Split toll booth, they were going past to another town.
Better to ask people - memorize a little Croatian - than to just walk around with a sign (if they say "Split" they wouldn't have picked me up)

Had a nightmare getting out of here but I think I was unlucky.
Recommend asking for rides to next service station, most rides far to Split or Zadar are full tourist cars. Also speaking to people works much better than just a sign (they'll dismiss you if they're not going to where the sign says)

Once again, bus stops proved to be the most succesful. We were 2 people (boy+girl) and got a ride to Split in like 10 minutes. Sign to Split. If you're going to Zagreb, ask to be dropped at the Mall of Split, it's easy to hitchhike from there.

2 people (boy+girl)
This spot is good because a lot of people from trogir and the split airport are going to Split. We got picked up after like 5 minutes by a local woman going home from work. There is a lot of space for the cars to stop.

A couple (boy + girl). We were trying to get to Zadar, so we had a sign for zadar but also Senj, because that's where a lot of locals go. We got very lucky because we got picked up by an amazing guy who was going all the way to zadar and he even bought us ice-cream on the way and took us all the way to our campsite. shout out to Niko!
Btw bus stations are the best.
Also a good spot if you are heading to Porec. It's roundabout so everyone slows down and can see you hitchhiking
This roundabout is best spot for hitchhiking in Pazin. I was here several times and always get a ride to Porec after 10-20 mins

Sunday morning, 9:30am.
3 Albanians guys were going to Switzerland. 5h drive, they leaved me in Rijeka. The spot is fine, I was lucky.
There is also a campsite on the other side of the road
Nice spot, I get a ride for Dubrovnik. A German couple stop for me and we stayed 5 days together üòÇ
Bus stop. Good spot towards Osijek. Surprisingly a lot of traffic for a small road. I don't know why you would be here though :D
when around asking drivers at the tolls, literally first car we asked took us all the way to Graz
onramp, good spot for pula of course and the local was really nice and took us exactly to where we want to
pretty decent spot we got a ride really quick all the way to Lupoglav
There are a lot of people coming to see this shop. We got ride really fast
There is a great place where people can stop their car. Lot of people going to Zagreb. We got ride really fast.
Two people with a sign to Pag. Got a ride to paclenica in no time.

It is difficult to go there. From Dubrovnik there is a little path to the bridge, after the last house (stonestairs). 
Once you are there it is easy. Got to split with a elevator guy(no tiktok)
We went to split with a sign. Behind you there are two lanes, where the car stopped

got a ride to vienna on a truck here. walk up to the beginning of the last lane so that people have time to move to the side. a police car was there but they didn‚Äôt care so maybe we ( girl and guy) were lucky.
31/8/23 I got there from Zadar and was instantly picked up by a car going to Novalja.

Did hitchike after the ferry because there was a storm and all the busses were full. A kind man stopped as he was the last car coming out and had some free space. Took us all the way to Rijeka where we had to go!
Waited 2 minutes and got picked up by a man on his truck direction Cres
Got dropped there from Maribor. Good spot to enter town.
Very good spot to Zadar
Great spot to get short rides around the coastline.

Deux personnes (1 homme, 1 femme). Nous partions de Split en direction de Dubrovnik / Mostar. Nous avons pris le bus 35. Nous nous sommes arr√™t√© √† l'arr√™t "PODI DOLIS 2". Ensuite nous avons march√©s 15min pour aller sur notre spot. Nous sommes rest√©s 200m avant le p√©age. Ils y a beaucoup de voitures qui passent. Quelques unes se sont arr√™t√©es. La majorit√© allaient √† Zadar / Zagreb. 2 ont demand√© de l'argent (10 et 20‚Ç¨). A la 33e minute, c'√©tait la bonne :) pour la 
... Gratuitement bien s√ªr ;)

Bon spot pour aller vers Zadar, ≈†idenik ou Split. Nous √©tions deux (homme et femme).
Good spot to go to Zadar, ≈†idenik or Split. We were two (men and woman)
Got a ride to Pula
to triest, take a sign, car can stop at the small honay vendor behind
A gas station. I asked a driver if she is going to Plocice, and got a ride to the border with Montenegro!
A lot of drivers, even at night. Easy spot for Ljubljana and Italy.
Got a ride after 10 min directly to Zagreb. So much better than at the border. A lot of cars there and they can see you very good and have space there to stop.
Was brought to Serbian border
Was picked quite fast by a guy who was going to Osijek to work
Ocasional mostly local traffic, got a ride to Vara≈ædin in 20 mins

Good spot, it's popular station on highway. I got ride directly to Belgrade in few minutes. If the driver asks you to came across the border by foot it is ok. The customs service are used to hitchhikers and crossing the border by foot.
We took a ride to Gradi≈°ka from there. Gas station with toilet and 24/7 service. Good spot.
Waited with a sign at the entrance, but then just went to gas station and the second car not only took us across the border to Banja Luka, but gave beers!

Waited less than an hour hitchhiking with a sign to Slavosnky Brod. 
You can access the Service Station from Novska, there's a road with a bridge that passes over the highway that goes to a nature reserve which can be entered through an openable gate. Once you're there go left through a dirt road, there's many huge wild pigs so be careful not to startle them, go straight and there's another opened gate to the station.
A lot of traffic, usually full cars with families going to holiday, not great to stop but it works

Best place for hitchhike on island Krk and further Lo≈°inj and Cres. Tried to hitchhike from there on Krk at least 20-30 times, and mostly needed only 10 to 20 minutes to get a ride, sometimes even less.
Not to much trafic, but better then enter to highway. Better chance to get to Zadar. I wait 5 minutes, but I think I had just big luck.
2 female hitchhiker: There is a tourist parking spot for looking at the bridge. Pretty easy to chat with the people
Great spot to get out of Zagrzeb, i had to wait for some time but after aprox 1 hour i got direct ride to zadar toll booths

Mostly fully packed family cars going on holidays. We were two men (czech.asian and ukrainian) hitchhiking to Rijeka. The beat way to get a ride was to cold approach drivers stopping at the petrol station. There a lot of traffic tho.
Loads of traffic, slow, wait just at the toll station, cars will see you, and the police doesn't mind. Great spot!

Great Spot 
Got there (2 people) at 11 PM and got a Ride by the First Guys we saw all the way to Zadar.

Good spot, it is possible to stand on the outer line on the highway, also gas station in reach. It is really sunny, no shadow at all - be aware of sunprotection. You dont have to be aware of cops and secriuty, they didn‚Äôt care at all. Also the lane on this side is mostly for truck drivers and less for small cars. We got a ride from a truck driver, who stopped on that lane and took us directly to Zadar. Some of the truck drivers, and ours too, are not taking the highway but the smaller roads - ju
Nice spot, a lot of cars and space for them to stop. Also shadow from the trees which is great in summer
lots of montenigrin cars

Best spot around, I had a sign saying Monte Negro, but not too many people, even who went there were willing to stop. Good traffic though, so I in the end found someone (they needed to convince me that they are not taxi and I needed to convince them that I am not looking for a taxi üòÖ)
I was at the bus stop in front of the airport. A man from Norway going to Montenegro took me to Herceg Novi where I can take a bus to Kotor.

First car accepted me.
You can take train from Zagreb to Kupljenovo after that 20 min walking .keep in mind that you have to cross the highway to the opposite side if you are going towards Slovenia, when I was there there wasn't much traffic, January morning weekday
Classic gas station. It would be a good spot, but croatians dont take hitchikers.
Got stuck here for nearly 5 hours. There is a lot of traffic here but no one wanted to pick us up
We were trying to leave Zagreb and this was really nice spot. You can take train to Kupljanovo and walk here.
There's a gas station over here. Really great gas station! It's lovely place, where you can easily get out toward Wien. It's took us about 5 minut to get lift from here directly to Poland.
Old dude said he would take me to Dubrovnik, ended up getting dropped in Orasac but was chill.
Bus stop, nice spot to hitchhike. It was raining when I was hitchhiking so I waited a long time. Get a ride to Opuzen
Milf picked me up and took me to split, said that I was a cute boy, great experience

quite good spot to catch a hitchhike to Hungary/Budapest, we were very lucky and some polish people gave us a ride straight to Budapest (we are also polish), but our friends that we left there hadn't so much luck and they were waiting there for someone to take them for 2hrs and they didnt even cross the border with that hitchhike so it depends
There's enough traffic to be comfortable that you'll be picked up. We waited only a few minutes before we got a ride all the way to Budapest.
free restrooms, caf√©, gas station, rest area, trucks, exchange money to Kuna but not from Kuna
one of the 2 gas stations on the highway between zagreb and the hungarian border, traffic isn't very high but enough to catch a ride after a while

Wonderful spot. There is a bus stop and lots of traffic going south of both turists and locals that go long distances. Got a ride to Bosnia (Una national park) from two dutch turists at around 2 pm with a sign that said south.
try to go long distance
Good spot, lot of traffic and all. You can even buy drinks. Started asking around and they brought us to opuzen.
A Croatian guy also hitchhiking gave up after about an hour.
Quite a long wait but had a direct ride to Zagreb :) Just before the sign that says "no hh", place for cars to stop and not too fast (waited 1h30 with a sign "Zagreb", solo male backpacker)
Good spot to get out of Zagrzeb, you have to catch at bus stop, i got ride to tool boot√≥w Fairly quickly
Good way to get to the Toll gate if you need to go from there, but we probably got very lucky. We had a sign "LUCKO", where the tolls are.
(direction south) waited for two hours, eventually a croatian guy that was going to Split picked me up. cars go fast but have plenty of space to stop.
Perfect place. Long line of sight, lots of space for people to pull over and almost everyone goes in the right direction.
Perfect omg. Best fat guy ever he was wine enthusiast and we drank bottle afterwards on his boat. Best Spot i ever was. Had a sign with SI/ST for ≈°ibenik or split
Good Spot with a place for people to stop. You could also press the traffic light, if you are mean haha

If you have crossed the sea by ferry you'd better try catch a car straight from the ferry. I didn't do that and walked all the way up on foot. When I came to the spot the ferry came back with new cars on board. So I had been waiting for about 10-15 minutes when one of the cars stopped. Then the driver lifted me to the Zagreb center. In conclusion, the spot really depends a lot on the timing when the ferry comes.
Its a good spot if you want to go rijeka/zadar/split. We stood with a sign at the exit of the station but you can ask people instead. Hard to get there though

Good place.
A decent amount of traffic, although most of it are full cars going on vacation.
Got there in the morning by bus from Zagreb, and found a shade at the end of the gas station.
A couple going on vacation took us all the way to Vodice on the coast near Split.
Took me some time and asking a lot of people to Zadar or Split. Ended up taking a ride to a town on the coast near Zadar
Stood there with a sign, didn‚Äôt even wait for 1 minute. Got a direct ride to Zadar from the very first vehicle who passed me.

From the center of Zagreb, take the 111 and stop at mercatone then walk to the gaz station. 
We were 3 peoples looking to go to Split, we wait around 40min before we found a car. You have to ask people directly to see where are they going. There was also toilets üëå
Many people going to MNE, much space to stop

Lots of people going to airport.
Asked and second guy picked us up.
lots of cars, feel like croatians dont really pick you up, lots of packed tourists as well

After waiting 1.5h in Du, and more than 1h here on a hot sunny august day, we took a bus back to Du and a bus to Montenegro. No cars stopped, and couldnt even get a car by asking on the gas station.
Most of people drive to the airport, locals rarely pass the border, many tourist cars are already full.
Got an advice from a local: do not use a sign! (people are reluctant to take you through the border. when they stop, just say to take you as south as possible)

Pretty good spot, with a lot of space to stop and a local bus stop in case things go wrong.
We ended up getting picked up by a taxi from Montenegro that gave us a free lift to Herceg Novi

Perfect place for Makarska/Dubrovnik.
I get there with nr60 buss. There is alot of space for cars to stop, drivers slov down on turn. Also for hich-hikers in summer there is some trees for shade. 
After 20 minutes of waiting, a couple picked me up to Makarska and offered me a place to stay.
In the summer the traffic was OK. Regardless of lots of space for cars we had some difficulties to find a ride. We used a sign "Mostar".
Not so much traffic, but with some patience you'll get a ride. Better to stand at the second exit/entrance to the bus station if you're going towards the south, as cars are going rather fast.
Very good spot towards banja Luka. Lots of space for cars to slow down and pick you up

July 2019 direction Ljubljana. One way or the other, the only option to go on the highway. Lots of space for car to pull by with cars from different countries (car plats), but not much traffic on a weekday afternoon. Waited around 20-30 minutes until a truck driver took me to the gas station right before Zagreb.

Toolbooth Okuƒçani.
Good for local trips and intercity.
A lot of cars leaving the Zagreb. No shade, so direct sun. A local guy took us to another gas station before Kutina.
Got a ride to Serbia this time, again took a bus from the city as far as possible after which I took a Bolt. Not the cheapest way but you get a ride out of the city 100%

The first toll booth leaving Zagreb. Great spot for Serbia or Bosnia & Herzegovina. We got a ride straight to Sarajevo from here. Sign recommended. Took a Bolt to here so not the easiest or cheapest spot to get to.

Good spot, not amazing. The traffic flow is verry high thats good. And there is a traffic light near so they are going quite slow. Was nice in the shade, and went fast to zadar.
great spot for cars to stop, locals gave us water. We went to the end of Vinkovci.
Not the best spot but it works. Hh on the island is relatively common as there is little to no public transport. Not a lot of traffic but that works in your favour I think.

It's not as good spot as the previous gas station(near Stinica harbour) as there might be many local people going back to Senj. Luckily the first person we asked from was going further away and promised to take us to Otoƒçac(we were going to Plitvice but that was the point our paths were separated and it's on the way there.)
We were heading from umag to trieste, there werent many cars, but a family of three stopped for us and took us to trieste.
Bus stop there, plenty of space for the cars to stop, but there are just few cars going fast on their way to Montenegro.
Decent spot but mostly Tourists and tourists are scared to take. Spot good ppl mid
it only tooked 5min but very bad spot, cars coming fast n i think it was luck.
In the evening, in April, there were not very many cars. This is a quiet place. Drivers slow down after turning.

I waited in the evening for about 30 minutes (1 person). But decided to spend the night in the garden, nearby. In the morning I was taken by a driver who helped me before. The place is normal, but the drivers ignore.Waiting time depends on your luck. You can leave quickly. Or you can stand for an hour. Rating does not affect
Should be a good spot, lots of through traffic and good space to pull over. Had to wait for an hour though until one of the nicest man picked me up.
Not so much traffic, more locally. Got invited to coffee in Vodice with the guy that picked me up.
Not mutch traffic, but relatively many people stop, but more go towards Pula. Got a ride right into the center of Rijeka.
Good spot for people to pull over, but not many are doing so.

Tuesday 12pm. I waited directly behind the border post in the small parking space entering Croatia. Border officers didn't care or maybe didn't see me. There is not much traffic but a couple from Bosnia took me to Capljina. If you're not as lucky as me try waiting for a bus in Klek

Plenty of space to stop. Cars see you from quite far. Sometimes people stop here to look at the view and take pictures, you can ask them directly then. Got a ride to Zadar after about 45min. The only negative point was that there was not much trafic (October 2024).
If you look out for the number plates, you'll get a ride to your preferred location relatively quick.

First we stopped to Split (almost 4 hours) with a thumb and a sing in a hand (change every 30 Minutes the variants). Than we want to go anywhere from this place, and go and ask every car to get out of there. In 45 minutes come one lady and say that she can go to the Zadar. We took this car.
We were a couple (girl und boy) with backpacks

Good spot, it is the magistrale on the coast. Some people stop there to park an swim, but we got a ride directly to split. If you don‚Äòt get a ride, there‚Äòs enough shadow, you can swim, there is dixies, and you have a nice place to put tent or hammok nearby.
Space for stop the cars. Ride to Zadar
Drivers can pick you up at the exit to Lidl.
We were trying to get to Split, but a lady stopped and offered a ride to Zadar, so we gladly took it.
Toll booths, lots of space to stop for drivers.

Just a gas station, you have to ask to get somewhere. If you're lucky, you can probably get all the way to split, but most people pass it on the way to the airport. Anyway, we asked a czech girl (we're also czech) to give us a ride to a better spot (the crossroad above airport).
We got very lucky and we got picked up really soon, by a local woman who used to hitchhike too. It is a bus stop, so it works everytime. Sign for Split.

Good spot, there were many people on holidays driving to Split or coming from the coast driving towards Zagreb. Mc Donald's and gas station is seperated in the two parts to the directions, cars can't cross that line, people can, so you immediately know who drives in which direction. (he stopped the car in the middle of the highway in Rejika and told us to leave the car to get
I arrived to this spot hitchiking from Porec, it's a bus stop so there's space, I got a ride from here to Pazin
Hitchhiked from here to Koper in 2021, it's before the entrence on a highway (toll booth), be ready to wait because there are a lot of cars but no one wants to stop

Not the best spot but it worked. Make a sign because cars can go to Zagreb/Trieste/Slovenia.
I get a ride to Pula with a sign
im a pretty woman, and that helps a lot. Jelsa - Sucuraj. It is uphill so the cars dont go too fast (but still fast)

31/8/23 It took me long way to the spot from city center but locals said it must have been good to go to Novalja from there. Well, they were right. Only 15 minutes afterwards I was caught a car that lifted me to the road crossing where the only left option was to for Pag/Novalja direction.
Okay spot to get to Sarajevo. Not so many cars from Bosnia are passing by, but it worked out after 45 min.
Not to many cars, mostly tourists. But after an hour we got a ride all the way to Poland.
Cars going in direction of Cavtat and airport
in direction of Rijeka
use a sign "otocac"

Good spot, just after the roundabout and just before a bus stop area so cars are slow with plenty of room to stop. After 40 minutes of waiting the first car with Osijek plates took me there

Nice spot to take a sailing boat. Come early in the morning (8-10am). I could have gone to italy from here, but it was not on my way. :(
At Thursday afternoon traffic was very low, 1 car in 15min.
Very easy just walk with a sign and wait and ask care. Don‚Äôt try to go to far, kotor or budva

Similar experience, not too busy, mostly trucks, there is water and a abandoned hotel good for sleeping also a supermarket near. A Serbian truck driver took me to the border at Shid (apparently they try to avoid the border at the highway due to traffic)

Little traffic, just like all the petrol station along this highway. Got offered a ride from a turkish truck driver to the last petrol station before serbian border.

Not really busy gas station, but there is frequent traffic. Took me some time but after a while, a truck driver took me to the serbian border. There is an old building beside the spot, which looks suitable to sleep, if you come here at night.

it's an empty gas station! 3 cars each 10min, got a ride only for some KM further direction Serbia with two nice young guys.
If you are two persons it will be hard for you (my case boy and girl) and specially in summer, lot of people going to Turkey and Syria with full cars, the real meaning of a full car! not even space to breath, anyway my advices is to separate and take trucks if you are two.
Waited about 45 minutes but then got a lift straight to Serbian border with a truck. This gas station is not very busy, or at least not busy on Monday mid morning.

Takes some time to get a ride. Probably because of the no Autostop sign. People only go in the direction of Zagreb m. If you wanna go south, you should take a ride to dobra gas station. You can get to the other side of the highway via a tunnel.
Rated very good for ZG, wait next to highway sign, with sign Zagreb :-)
Besides, if you want to go south, consider a sign for Zagreb anyway, get out at petrol station Dobra and cross the highway carefully on foot to the southbound station.
After I put an AUTOSTOP OK sign over the NO AUTOSTOP sign, it was a matter of minutes...
Got picked in up in no time. Two people. There is shadow and a place where cars can stop easily
Good pullout but lots of local beach traffic
Took the bus here from Split. Place for cars to stop, didn't have to wait long.
the way to get there by foot is awful, went around asking people but loads of locals only, a women gave a small hitch to the tolls at Lucko

Waited 1,5h on tuesday at 8.30 am. Then walk to Lucko pay tolls and get a ride in 2 min. So if you have the choice, my advice is to catch a bus from Zagred to Lucko directly.

I travelled here in begin of october. Just waited 30 minutes and got cought from a crazy, funny guy. Take tram number 4 to last station, than walk for an half hour to the station. Got quickly to Split.

I found ride in a few seconds here. I was going on Luƒáko to Zadar. Most of people that stops there are going on highway so i think it's easy to find a ride. My friednd also find a ride very quickly. ;)
Good place but no so much shadow and mostly local traffic.
Got a ride instantly to Dubrovnik with a sign
Shitiest spot ever, so many Cars passing by, but not even one stopped, we had to go by bus
Very nice spot, get picked up almost instantly
forget about it.
best spot around at the bus stop
Nice in the shade, enough slow traffic. Nice spot.
Two males, waited for 40minutes before being picked up by a camping car, clearence is good and cars can easily stop. On our way to the north

An okay spot with lots of traffic and I got picked up quickly.
Somewhere on this road there is a pay toll. Worked for Zagreb direction.

Spot is good with cars going slowly and a gas station nearby. Had a sign to split and stood here from 8 to 11. Nobody stopped and i ended up taking a ride to the next town. However this messed me up as i was unable to make my way to split. Prefer the highway.
The cars go slowly there, plenty of time to decide and plenty of space to stop. I got a ride from an Uber driver (didn't have to pay ofc hehe) and some interesting life advices. :)
pretty long but guy with nice hair tooked me
A la sortie du camping de Simuni, il y a des arr√™ts de bus de chaque c√¥t√©, tr√®s bien pour faire du stop. Il y a beaucoup de passage. Par contre peu d'ombre, attention au soleil !

last gas station before to the road to Zadar. Great station to be stop if you want to go to the North of Croatia. Lot of trafic.

Derniere station service avant la bifurcation pour Zadar. Station service avec beaucoup de trafic pendant les vacances d'√©t√©.

To Zagreb, one of the first cars stopped (~5 mins) and took me all the way.

I Quickly got ride to split, great spot
Toll booth. I haf a sign to Split and the minute I put it up I got a ride!

Cars need to wait so we could ask them directly. Ride only for 8km to Novi Vinodolski but it is a bigger town at least

No car stoped

Eventhough the gas station is closed, there is space for cars and it worked! Got ride towards Ploƒçe
Not a great spot, gas station was closed. But if its open, i think still a good spot.
gas station
Good spot to go to Split toll booth - ask around if anyone is leaving on the highway (autocesta).
It is hard to highway from this place, only get small road to zagreb direction
Just ask a ride to Dugopolje pay-tolls and hitch-hike with a sign from there to whichever direction (N/S) you're heading.

I took a lift after about an hour with two Chilean toursits going to Krka Park. not much traffic at late afternoon

got lucky with a truck ride straight to budapest, but not sure how great this spot is otherwise. mostly local cars refuelling here but there are many hungarian and slovenian truckers here.

Crodux gas station on the east exit from Zagreb. It's a standard modern gas station with a cafe, ATM and all that. The traffic through here is decent enough to get picked up fast.
Super spot. Hard to get if you are not drop by a driver. But there is traffic and also a lot of tourists that can take you.

spent 1hour in the monday evening and nobody seemed to care. slept in the forest across the highway and tuesday morning from 6am till 12:30 stood with big sign Italy/Austria/Ljubljana (Slo) and there were tourists, but all their cars were full. mostly locals and they don't cross border's .  I was hopping for a better place. decided to walk back to city and take a bus to Italy .

A great spot! beautiful! lots of cars, and there‚Äôs space to stop a vehicle. But empty cars don‚Äôt stop.  was one person, in bright clothes, with a small backpack. Sunny day. Hitchhiking in Croatia isn‚Äôt very good. I started around 6:30 in Split, but didn‚Äôt reach Dubrovnik before sunset.
be careful with this place in summer - theres no shade at all around, just stones, it can be nasty in hot days...

We didn't get a ride at the former kiosks. The people drove to fast and didn't stop. We just went back to the gasstation. There we were really lucky to get a ride directly to split with an awsome driver!
Petrol station 300 meter before access to the motorway.

There is good place on buss stop, not much traffic in middle of week, but a lot of drivers stop.
Rumanian family gived a ride to center of Dubrovnik.
 Very good ride, we stopped to steal some tangerines from fields)
Waited 3 hours. No one is stopping here. But the view is awesome!

waited here 2 hours. its became dark and cold. finally we had to take the bus to split. but it was a nice ride all the way from Sarajevo... just the end. better to take highway if you want to reach bigger cities. this road is amazing, but only if you have time :-D
Good spot, some shade from the electrical house. Loads of traffic that can stop at a bus station.
waited here for 20 min in direction Rijeka, but instead i took a ride with a bus(17KN) to tool booths Brale near place Posedarje
Saw one guy leaving within 20 minutes and 3 girls within 45 min. We (couple) were last and waited 1.5 hours. Not a bad spot (bus stop to pull over and a service station to ask)

I was standing 100m before the raundabout and a nice woman stopped us and took us to the next town - Putini. From there we continued to Vrsar.
not 5 min passed and a car took us to rijeka

to Rijeka.
it takes time to get a car - most likely just of a short ride.

It's a gas station, so you have to ask people. We tried hitchhiking for 1 hour and then we asked some czech people (we're also czech) to take us and they were also going to lake Balaton. We got beer and they eventually stayed in the same camp as we did so it was a lot of fun. I always hesitate to ask people but it's usually fruitful, so don't be afraid! the worst that can happen is that they say no and you will never see them again.
traffic is rather low here but people are going the right way. waited 24 min here and a nice hungarian driver with a spacey car took us all the way to Budapest. asking with big smiles are key

I would try to avoid next time, maybe stay at the tolls after Zagreb and wait for a ride directly to where you want to go.
Petrol station towards north (Hungary). Not very busy one (tuesday, beginning of september).

leaving Pula was a nightmare, but eventually found a ride to move closer to Rijeka and Zagreb. Had a sign RJ/ZG

Two cars stopped for me, but the first one offered me a ride to the airport, it wouldn't have been a good choice to take that ride though as most ppl from the airport are going back to Pula.
Lots of local cars.  Almost the longest wait on the way home. Finally, a guy who had given us a ride from Karlovac to Rijeka earlier hitchhiked us :D We had been lucky.
There is a bus stop here, so there's enough space for cats to stop. Right before the highway northward.

avoid that shi spot. I got taken by germans cause i was german in a stuffed vw furniture was lying on top of me. Nobody stops although the spot looks good. Had a sign MNE, but they said they wanted to ask me for directions not take me

Good spot.

Cilipi-Herceg Novi: Got dropped off here headed to Herceg Novi. Waited about 40 minutes with very very light traffic before I just started walking towards the border on the highway. Got picked up 6 KM later.

I dont know if this was bad luck or the late hours Or the fact that we tried hitchhiking with 3 ppl but nothing nothing would stop for us. The gas station is empty and only locals there. There are a few spots where cars could stop down the rode but we couldn't get anything until it got dark. I'd recommend taking a bus to Omis (idk how much it costs we didnt buy a ticketü§£) and from there try to catch a ride to makarska or Dubrovnik.
I do not like gas stations ... This was the first experience in Croatia. 1 (M), 6:30. Easter holidays in April. The driver drove only 15 km ... I agreed
Lots of cars passing, but we (M+F) stood there for quite a while without anyone stopping. First car that stopped took us to Makarska
Lots of local people in the of season. We just got a ride to Omis.

Waited here for 5 min. Got a ride to Makarska.
Better place than bus stop at access road
Got a ride to the toll gates at Dugopolje.
Sign "Dubrovnik" got me a quick ride to Opuzen. It is a busy road and a good place to stop for cars!

Waited here for almost 2 hours than a guy took me to the highway. It's really better to get near the highway by bus or something

two guys, tried with different Signs,"SLO LJ, A3, Graz,A2" on 29.Dec, waited 3h and no car stops. then we walk along to the entrance of the Highway for both direction, still no car stop even they can see us clearly and they are going to the Highway. Total waiting time 5h, then give up, took the train to LJ.
It is a bad place. Nobody stops there.

Best is to take the risk and work right on the motorway. For Ljubljana I gotta walk past the other two major turns to Split and Maribor. Then there is a huge area for stopping and it shouldnt take more then ten minutes to stop a car. The police definitely takes longer to come by. Absolutely worth breaking the law ;)

Often full cars with families. Hard enough to leave this place if you stay at parkings but you will find at least :)

I had some very good fortune while standing at the entrance to the hotel (no sign); the sixth car took me all the way to Podgarice, Montenegro. There are many tourists and people in transit who make this a great spot!

Hitchhicked here last summer. Best thing to do is to go to the Hotel and see if people leave. We were lucky and got a lift after a few minutes until austria
Its worth trying
quite low traffic area. I waited at the last entrance next to the bus stop and luckily got a ride with a german family. Most of the people are going to Zadar.

Not really a good spot, but this is probably the only place which works if you want to go to north and you were in the city before. We waited 3 hours, only 3 car stopped, but the first two went to wrong direction

very bad place, not much traffick, we waited more than 2 hours and some guy took us to a gas station on the highway, you should head there because it is the only way to get to north (we were heading to Budapest) (group of 6 girls)

goal trieste

August 2015, got a ride in one hour and half. It was end of afternoon and dark. A local next to the spot bring us cakes tho.
Cars go fast and a lot of local traffic. Also no shade, so the sun is relentless in summer. We stood here for a few hours fruitlessly, before heading in the other direction.
We've waited here 1,5h on Saturday's evening with no luck. Managed to come back in the morning but our plans changed so we didn't test this spot properly in the end.

Bus stop, the cars can stop easily. However, nobody stopped for more than 3 hours (solo male with sign Makarska/Dubrovnik). The croatians were more into making fun of me than helping me :( maybe better in the high season
The cars go very fast here... I got a ride after 40 minutes, just to get outside the city...
Waited 2.5 hours here and did not get a ride. Lots of traffic but most seem to be going only slightly down the road. If looking to get to Dubrovnik, do not recommend
Here is a good location for hitchhiking, before bus stop I wait less than 20 min. My destination is heading to Makarska. If there is no car stop, you still can choose take bus

i guess best option for ploƒçe/dubrovnik dirrection. theres a bus stop where cars can stop, but mostly those that come from center of city. in this place you miss most of cars that pass the city. still is relatively good place. ask first because most of them go not far away. split is hard for hitchiking in general for heavy traffic, exspecially in summer.
I wait a Lot, not a Lot of car here..
this is goo place where you can ask people while they wait on the traffic light. Usually it is great toward pay tolls for both east toward Slavonija and Belgrade or toward Hungarian border

There are traffic lights here - place is very bad for direction East (A3) (90% of the cars going there are on the 2nd or 3rd lane on the lights, so they cannot stop) 1st lane goes on the bridge (directions North/South on A4;D3 roads) - for that direction it's a good spot

A lot of trafic but people barely look, cars are going fast
I got lucky and a couple picked me up - i think the big sign i had helped a lot
Impossible here - i would go serbia but I wait 1 day and half and I gave up‚Ä¶
Lots of cars but no one stopped
40 minutes for a ride almost to the border with Serbia. You can get here with a bus from the city

We were standing first close to the sign before the junktion that goes off from the main street. We were 2 people, it was Saturday around midday. Had a sign with Belgrade/toll station. Waited 2 hours. Then moved to the gas station. In general lots of traffic, mostly local cars\people, driving to the stupid outlet or IKEA. We tried to ask people for a lift to the toll station, but didn‚Äòt work. Not much people at the gas station. After four hours we gave up.

(direction ferry to Pag) none of the cars going down picked me up even though it would only be a 5 min ride... I ended up walking down the road, if you wanna catch the ferry just walk down it is 30 min

stuck here after the people I was riding with took the ferry to pag. Waited for ages lots of cars heading north very few south. A bus picked me up but wanted about 15 euros to go to Zadar, i refused and waited for a bit until a van driver picked me up.
Nice spot, enough traffic.
no much traffic on the gas station, maybe because its very small and old

[10.08.2010] we were told to leave the patrol station, otherwise he would call the police...
see other patrol station mark/spot
Terrible, i made mistake of trying to catch a car going Zagrzeb there 2 hours 0 cars stopowe

Bus Stop. There's plenty of space to stop for cars, traffic goes somewhat fast, but I guess bearable. Took a little long, but got a perfect shot, Bosnia truck driver who was going all the way to Doboj, we shared a nice chat and he bought me some Bosnia food.

Nice place, but demands perseverance.

It's 15-20 min of walk from town and lots of cars are passing trough. It's good for HH if you're going in Zagreb or somewhere in that way.

If you're unlucky you can sleep under the bridge or in small forest that is near or you can walk to Center of youth "Prostor" in Dr. Ivana Novaka street 38, after gas station. Every traveler is welcome there! ;)

This place is probably good if you're feeling heroic enough, because it is extremely dangerous. there is like 5 lanes from both directions and cars are going very fast from both sides. If you're going south, it's probably good, but we were trying for Hungary and we weren't even brave enough to cross the road to get there. We decided to take a bus (and tram and then another bus) to Sesvete and start from there.

Tried hitchhiking with a SLO sign in the evening; nobody stopped after 1.5h, so I went for a Zagreb sign instead and got a lift to a western suburb within minutes (had to take a bus and a tram to get to the city but both are easily boarded without a ticket). Try getting dropped of at the petrol station instead.
I waited for 2 hours, and the police came to say that it's not possible to stop here, so I finally decided to take the bus to go to the city center...
There's so many directions, you have to be very lucky to find someone that take you here...
Waited for around 40 minutes in ≈°etaliste 13. Divizije with no luck. Then Went here. Still almost nobody takes hitchikers in croatia
Not many people but we got lucky, not much shade but a good place to stop. We were heading to KRK
The spot is not that good, but in theory it can be, but the traffic was very low.
Wanted to go to Split but in Mai it‚Äòs not much people driving south especially at this place. I recommend going to Zadar and hitchhiking from there to Split or Sikebenik:)

Cars go super fast and we waited a lot. The bus passes here also but we had no cash lol 
Spot has no shadow. I hope you get lucky!

2 people, a boy and a girl. We were on our way to Zadar through the jadranska Magistrala and we could't get out of rijeka, so we took a bus to this station and tried from there. It is not the best one, but it works to go south.
Good spot going to Serbia

The shittiest place I have ever hitchhike, i'm sorry for this word but I waited for 6 hours to catch a car to Belgrade and a friend of mine took her 4days to catch a car to Belgrade! it's so weird because there is no empty cars passing by! they are all full. unbelievable! I never waited this time in my life and i'm surprised because the borders they were only in some km and it's a highway with lot of traffic. My conclusion hitchhiking in Croatia is awful.

You might expect a gas station on the highway to be a great place. I actuallly had to wait 21 hours to get a ride towards belgrade. ANd actually a quite short ride with a truck driver to the border queu that involved 3km walking. At least it's a great place to camp, but consider that it's closed at night and during the day toilet is with payment. There is also a free chemical toilet on the truck park.
Chances might be higher if you go towards Osijek
Not a very good place indeed. Very low traffic and most of it goes to Osijeka or is local. Still, probably your only option around here if you want to go to Belgrade.

we were waiting here for about 2 hours becouse gas station was small and few cars stoped there and only foreign people stoped by from germany and sweden etc.But this station is the biggest one there around... others are even smaller.Best hitch stop if you going to serbia.
This place is currenly under construction.
We were probably just lucky, got a ride all the way to Slavonski Brod in less than an hour
Was trying for Split and it took me a few hours, would recommend another spot. [Blog Post about journey](http://www.hobospirit.com/hitchhiking-from-zagreb-to-split/)

If you are going towards Rijeka, consider walking to the junction and to the toll station/gas station there. About 3km in total from this spot, but if you get off at the junction instead of the gas station in the first place it's just about 1,5km...
The wors place I know. After two days here we left this place by foot. We tried to ask to drivers, to stand with sign - tried "Beograd", "Split", "ZG" (Zagreb) and "KA" (Karlovac)
no comment

Waited here 30 minutes and car stoped for Buzet (village near border with Slovenia). Many trucks and cars are resting there. A lot of cars are going from here to nerby villages so deffinitely use a sign with direction.

Waited 2h in total. A very kind lady took us way out of her way to up to the highway past Bakar. (Thank you so much<3). Not a good place at all, we just got lucky. everyone were locals and were pointing to highway so find a way to get up there...
Worst post ever for two guys hitchhiking, in 3hours of hitchhike NOBODY stopped, not so many tourist only croatians

Many cars going to Rjeka, Pula and Zagreb, not many going south. Also lots of Romanians and Bosnians, but most cars don‚Äôt have a whole lot of space, so better for solo travelers. Got a ride to Zagreb after asking someone with the right numberplate. Nice and helpful staff at the gas station

Petrol station where I got stucked for  couple of hours heading from Pula to Zagreb. Not a good spot, lot of local traffic and people were not very heplful. When I ended up there second time wanting a ride to south (Split), I decided to go to city center and try it from other spots.

I met two Belgian girls there wanting to get to Split, also decided to change the spot after four hours.

Ask people for a ride to the center of Rijeka.
I waited 3 hours (mid October) and nobody took me. Even if I asked people (just to go to Zabok), they all said no. So I had to across the highway and finish by walking. (Solo woman travellerl

To Zagreb. I was there around 5:30 in the evening on a Monday. There were almost no cars and only a couple of trucks (who were going to Zagreb the next morning). I was there for 30 mins and only saw a few full cars come into the station. I ended up just walking to Sveti Kriz Zacretje and taking the train (was 33.60 kn). 

If you were here during a more prime time (summer, earlier in the day) I think it'd be pretty easy to get a ride to Zagreb. It's only 46 km or so.
Priobalna ulica. Follow this road you will see the bus stop. This spot have limited time. Only when construction still going. Then it's super good spot.

If you use Google map. And search. "Autobusna stanica Jadranska avenija". This spot is around here a bus stop. Ppl can easy stop there. I m here today. It was lucky cuz this moment the road have construction. So if you walk to this place. All the car to this direction will pass you slow.  Very good for hitch hike. But when contraction done. You might need to find another spot.  Just be careful the round about is disappeared cuz the construction. So when you take bus to around this place. Get off
Very hot place in summer, met hitch-hikers (a couple) who were there since 1h30 so it seems not to be a great spot. We (a couple) got a ride in 40 min at the gas station nearby.

Stayed here for 2 hours without a sign, in a very hot August Sunday, direction Rijeka. Only two cars stopped, none of them in my direction. Maybe with a sign would be much easier. Seems easier to get a ride at the gas station.

There is a bif traffic sign that provides a little bit of shadow (useful in the hottest summer days). The cars can see you from a far distance, and just after the sign there is a place where cars can stop. Since there still are a lot of potential directions from here it would be important to have a big sign.
Very busy road but no one stops here. Cars also drive quite fast so not much time to think. After 3 hours a tourist took me to Dubrovnik.

We saw that bad review on this spot, so we decided to try it by our self. It‚Äôs a good bus station, lots of space for car to stop. We were quite lucky because we waited only 3 minutes and quite young guy stoped and took us to Dubrovnik
No one stopped, and police told us to get somewhere else

It seems a great spot to hitch to Mostar or Dubrovnik and it very likely is HOWEVER be very careful. I exited the car of my host and lit up a smoke and within 2 minutes an unmarked police car stopped me and demanded my papers, after asking for their ID they told me the only ID I needed to see was there gun before eventually showing something real. They got me to unload the entirety of my bag and found an empty weed grinder and then tried to charge me 500 euros, they then forcefully took my passp
Horrible stop we waited 4h to get someone. At meast the view is beatiful and thats a bit strange because the spot is perfect
Super bad experiences there on our way to Zadar/Split. Few cars and noone wanted to stop.

Horrible place. Only local people come here. Since Croatia is a part of the EU, no one comes here to cross the border. If you wanna go far, I advise you to walk about 500 m untill the motorway, it still hard, but a bit better.
We got a ride to Zagreb from this place. The traffic is very low, not so many trucks going here. We were lucky to find an old man who took us.

My first experience was horrible. With my mate we were standing there over 5 hours, or maybe even longer. But all after all we have found track driver who took us to Brno in Czech Rep.

In 2012 I left this place with the third car... U need just to ask.

Remember to go at least to Nagykanizsa, it will be much easier to reach the motorway from the city.
Waited for 4 hours there!
The traffic is 1 car every 5 minutes, and the majority goes to nearby villages (not the highway). Avoid this road!

it was better to walk in to the next village and catch a bus.
very low and unfriendly traffic.

Waiting for a ride to split. I got approached by a local on foot which kicked me out of the town. He was pissed at me, only spoke Croatian and refused to collaborate using a translator. Had to walk to next bus stop on the side of the road. Spot is otherwise okay.

This place is okay, because there is a lot of space for the cars to stop (it's a bus stop, those are the best). Sign to ≈†I/ST (≈°ibenik/Split)
We got picked up by a guy going all the way to Split, but he needed to do something in ≈†ibenik, so he left us at a restaurant and promised to come back for us and he didn't. It was quite shitty, but he helped us a lot and he was nice. Lesson learned: always take a phone number if you agree on something like that.
Can't find this spot. Better keep going further.
2 female hitchhiker: next to the mainbus station, we waited on the opposite site of the street. There is a little lets call it lawn. we waited 15 minutes.
Waited 1h, got a ride from the first car that stopped only to the first gas station south. Most of the cars are going only to the airport.

All this area seems pretty bad.. people dont stop.. cause its dubrovnik.. tourists... i met other hhiker so we drink a bottle of wine and had fun.. on the end old local guy stoped and took us on the end of town.

Very bad place even with traffic lights. Were travelling boy-girl towards Budapest, waited for almost an hour (with the avg. waiting time 20 min), one guy stopped from feeling pity for us and gave us ride to the ramp.

Direction : Herceg Novi. My hope with catching a ride with a Croatian driver went down really hard this day. Caught a ride from Cavta 2 KM torwards Croatian border after waiting two hours. Had to walk 6 KM to this point and found myself lucky to catch a ride with a Croatian woman headed for Tivat. Even she said "Croatian people need to be more open minded". Got this ride in 5 minutes with high doubts of getting a ride. Maybe it's my luck..  IDK

Zvekovica-Herceg Novi: Right after the turn to Cavtat and right before airport is a decent spot to catch a ride. However most of the people headed that direction are going to the airport. Locals apparently hate Montenegro and don't go (War grudges). Got lucky to catch a lift to at least to ƒåilipi to avoid the airport traffic. Had to walk 6 KM towards border before a driver picked me up from there. Awful. Croatians need to be more open minded man!

Sibenik - Trogir: Waited for 2 hours with no success. Decent traffic flow and open space for cars to stop. Good place for people to see you. Just not my day I guess. Caught a bus instead at the bus station.
Pula-Rijeka: Waited about an hour and change mid day and no success. Two people stopped to offer me rides but not very far. Ended up doing a Blablacar.

Tried to hitch an aeroplane. I was well prepared to meet pilots and plane owners but the employees at the airport were very unfriendly and even rude. They wouldn't even let me properly introduce myself and present the idea. Hitching planes greatly depends on the people who work there and I just had bad luck with having grumpy employees. More luck next time.

Petrol station towards Plivice lakes.
Driver dropped me off in no mans land.
No one has to stop here for gas.
Sign could be useful.
Had to walk down the road for 25 km to get to Slujn.
Maybe bad luck?!
Probable bad to Zagreb. But I was there when it was rainy.
Bad to catch car to Zagreb
We 2 man stayed here the Busstation at Sunday around 1,5 hours but no ride.
tried zagreb or split from here but it did not work i guess it migh be worthwhile to walk or hitch to the petrol stations in each direction both are fairly close
Wanted to go to Zagreb in summer 2012. Not much traffic.

We were witing more then 2 hours then desided to go by foot to the border (hoped to find petrol station) but police stop and we paid penalty (100 HRK each, but they made "discount" for us and we paid 100 for both)
The point is not so bad, but nobody stopped for us during 2 hours. We needed to go back to the city and look for a sleep.

Not the easiest place to get a ride but the only choice if you're stuck here. After about an hour, we (two guys) convinced a couple to take us to the toll booth in Zadar. Go to the end of town though, as at the beginning (coming from Rijeka) room renters stay there with signs, looking like hitch-hikers.
i tried for several hours to get a ride towards rijeka but without success...

Beware that not alot of people want to take you over the border. We had waited a few hours before deciding to walk over the border to Montenegro. Long but quite scenic walk. If you do want to hitchhike this bus stop has plenty of room to let cars stop.
waited for 3 hour to Rovinj direction, then girl picked us up for 15 km..very difficult to h-h on coast line..
We also tried to get to the motorway but there was nearly no traffic or the cars were full.

[10.08.2010] after no chance at the patrol stations we got a ride here. we had a sign A1 / ZG it took quite a while - ca 40 min.
Better go east/south - should be easier!
But still so many full tourist cars...
You need to wait a lot of time here. We wait more that 1 hour then man take us straight to Osijek
Got told to change the place because it wasn't a good spot. I waited there for about 10 min.

Just a road heading south towards Zadar and Split. Lot of free figs around during the summer :). We hitched for 2 hours (with and without sign) and did not get any ride at all. Wanted to get to Zadar.
waiting long and still not picked up, we hike all the way up to Jancova
really out of luck to wait for holiday family cars (mostly packed) going up.
we started waiting at 5pm to Slavonski Brod. Long wait and only get a lift to the train station of Ivankovo
don't be fool by the road sign pointing to Osijek. Most transports go to near by blocks not even as far to Pozega. If you wanna go north, go for D51

Tried to go to Zagreb, got a lift after about 10-15 min. There is an emergency lane and cars go quite slow in the curve. Moved to this side after hitching for a while on the road where the cars come from the south, but there they are quite fast.
Bad place for HH.Friend and me HH here maybe 3 hours with no luck at all
I waited 2 hours with a sign for East Croatia, Monday afternoon, late Sept 2012. I got picked up finally by people who took me to the toll at the beginning of the A3 South-Eastwards.

Gas station going South towards Zagreb - you'd end up here if trying to get past Zagreb and your lift to that point was going a different direction. 

Out of the holiday period, it appears to be very quiet (I was there on a Monday afternoon, late Sept 2012). Not a good place to be at all. You're best off looking for a ride to the road toll gates on the side of the city you want to be on, and then trying to get longer distances from them.
Towards Hungary.
Didn't manage to hitchhike further, had to stop a bus, but there is free wi-fi. :)

Malinska, toward mainland (Rijeka).

Cars go too fast, can't see past the turn and can't stop.

Don't let anyone drop you off here if they're headed into Malinska. 
Happened to us after a ride from the ferry from Cres. Had to walk quite far to find a place where cars could stop (about 15-20 min north).
There is also a petrol station at the main entrance to Malinska. Ask your ride to drop you off there.

Cres town, INA petrol station, toward Merag (ferry to Krk).

A direct ride will be very hard, but you can talk to people at the petrol station. They might be willing to take you to the main road toward Porozina.

The intersection toward the Kovacine autocamp is a better place for further travel.

Direction Losinj might yield better results.

Direction: D7, Dakovo, Croatia
Didn't get away from there in more than an hour; traffic seemed to be mostly local

Direction: South, Croatia
There's a toll-station, where Auto-Stopping is actually forbidden, but the guy there was quite tolerant.
Traffic was very low in the evening, but since almost all the cars have to stop it's not impossible.

[11.08.2010] stood here at night (10pm-0) and there were only a few cars (mostly tourist cars - full!), no one was going to the Highway A1, direction Zagrab, next day 1pm also no chance to get a ride. even after the junction, (there are 2 benches) with a sign made no difference. the other patrol station is the same, finally i got a ride were both streets come together.
try to get out

Ne tre bona poento. Ili permesis al ni petveturi ƒâi tien nur ƒâar a≈≠to lasis nin ƒâe la paspago kaj neniu kondukis nin tra la limkontrolo, kaj ni venis piede, kio estas malpermesita, sed ni klarigis, ke la ulo lasis nin tien kaj jam transiris, do ni devus provi tie. Ili forstampis nin, sed petis nin piediri al la alia limo. Ili rifuzis kaj devigis nin piediri reen ƒâar ni povis transiri nur per veturilo.... tiom laca pro la tromado de la limkontrolistoj. Mar≈ùi 6 km por nenio krom babilado kaj stult
got people pointing up to the highway but no actual stops.We gave up and walked to a better spot. We used a Bakar sign

2 guys with backpacks, hitchhiked to Zadar with sign Zadar.
It's a sunny spot (sunscreen recommended)
High traffic going slow and cars have a nice spot to stop
Very very low success rate tho...took us 90 minutes even with high traffic
The village is difficult to leave but I thinks for that it‚Äôs the best spot, also a bit of shadow and place for cars to stop, in the offseason it should be really hard though

Not really ideal, a lot od traffic but usually packed holidaymakers, only road that leads to Krk and everyone was obviously going there but noone stopped for 45 minutes. In the end a nice polish guy stopped for us.
This place was nightmare but we got extremely lucky and got ride to Split.
The best of horrible options around, bus stop, after an hour we got moved to much better place

This is a difficult spot to hitchike from: 

1) the traffic is moving very fast. 
2) for cars to see you, you have to stand on the highway and try to signal for them to enter the service area. 
3) when we were there, very few cars came into the service area. 
4) it isn't easy to leave the service area. It's an easy place to get stuck with nowhere to go. The nearest alternative spots on the highway are 15-20km away. 

Me and my hitchhiking friend decided to walk across the fields to the sm
Not a great location. Very hot in the sun and a long walk up te mountain. Recommend going over the bridge. But thats also a long hike‚Ä¶ got a ride there very fast tho, look at the other pinpoint.
Spot is okay with a bus stop and space for cars to stop. Did here for 2,5 hours in the afternoon but had to take a bus in the end. Direction sibenik tried with thumb and then with sign to split.

The longest wait of our trip. We asked first from some people at the gas station but they adviced us to make a sign and stand thumb up on the side of the road. We were trying to get to Plitvicka Jezera, but many cars weren't propably going there that late. We ended up waiting 45min before a sweet couple picked us up and took us there(they had turned back to get us <3)

We wanted a ride to the gas station on the big road. We searched for a spot but there was not many cars going and not much space to stop so we walked back to the harbour. When the ferry arrived 16.20 we tried to get a ride from them with our thumbs up but no-one picked us. Then I started asking around in the harbour bar and one sweet slovenian man, Robert took us. He also bought us 1,5l water and peach ice tea bottles from the gas station and wished us luck‚òÜ

Only gas station when you want to get out of the city direction south. We had no other option so we stayed there more than two hours, many people going to Hungary or west of croatia. At the end we were just super lucky and one guy took us to huge highway parking place behind Dakovo
We had to stop a carto get to the gas station on the highway, but the spot is not good at all as there is barely any international traffic

Long waiting in the sun before a young and nice Bosnian drove me to Zadar. A German guy also stopped but he was not going in the direction of my destination. In the way to Croatia, there were lots of cars but they were coming out one by one because of border controls.

I spent too much time here. I thought it would be easy to go to Split (I had on my sign), but the opposit was true. Try to get just any ride, I drove to Odmori≈°te Prokljan, where it was much much easier to move forward

Safe spot, lots of traffic, but mostly local. Also, cars are pulling into the bus stop all the time to unload or do whatever, blocking it for you. After 90 minutes a friendly local gave me a ride to after the bridge, and dropped me at the much better spot there. You would be much better off starting there.

Safe spot, but very little traffic. Hitchhiked north here after I finished hiking the Via Adriaca in Prevlaka. If you're in the area, there really isn't much choice, this is the spot.
Only five cars in an hour early in the morning, but the fifth took me to Dubrovnik.
A guard from the border post came up to check on me, but he just wanted to see my ID, no hassle.
Girl and boy, we tried for 2 hours going south, then moved more to the south to the exit from the town, where we were immediately picked up. We used sign ‚Äúsouth‚Äù.

A good place to stand, shadow in the afternoon, nice view, enough space for cars to stop. But didn‚Äòt get a ride. We tried with and without signs, but seems like most people are staying in the area. Maybe not a good spot for afternoon as well (expect the shadow).
a camping car brought us to this small place where cars go really fast and are mostly full. Stayed for 3 hours and ended up taking a bus to Riejak
On our way back north through the coast road, lot‚Äôs of traffic but very few people stop. Got picked up by a local for 10minutes
waited over 3hrs not much luck going to pula had to sleep the night and in the morning it took us 10 mins to catch a hitch
pretty bad spot not much traffic got a ride to Pazin after 3 hrs

Perhaps, it was my bad luck but I waited 30 minutes or more and then decided to walk to the ferry on foot. About at the half of the way I was eventually picked by a car going to ferry too. Tbh the traffic is pretty awful (about a car/2 mins) and most of them are full of people. P.S. perhaps someone will find this useful: the price for the ferry (09/23) is 4,3‚Ç¨ per person.

After here have a place ppl cam safe to stop. Cross the road is a car fix place. It's nice to stand here. Even they drive fast. But ppl cam see you from a bit distance also have big place can park. I got pick up by the person with the boat. He can totally park in the spot. I was going to Senj
Should have walked a few hundred meters east and tried on the gas station...
Of course it's sensless spot as it's not only inside city, but even quite close to the city center.

Waited 3 hours in the hot sun for a lift to A4 / Budapest. No Car stopped!
Senseless
cars going fast but lot of space to stop, no one picking me up for more than 2 hours to Dubrovnik, stick to main highway
Horrible spot. We took a bus to get out to dubrovnik nobody stop. The place is good for cars to stop but nobody stop. I dont recommand it
Tried to hitchhike from here heading towards Zrce, but in 90 minutes no car stopped even if there is place to stop safely...
saw a pheasant on the way :P
got dropped of at the intersection. no cars stopped from here, walked 4,4km to the next intersection
Although very close from here the highway starts and although there is a big bus stop before it, after 4-5 hours of waiting with signs we weren't picked up towards Trieste. Maybe we weren't lucky...
There is a bus stop on the top of the hill, before the intersection towards the highway that goes to Ljubljana and Trieste.
take anything
good luck
no one picked us up, a taxi stopped to ask us where we are going, we said we dont have money, he thought about it for a couple minutes, then took us to a better spot
Croatians dont take hitchikers. Still i thing this place Is better than the bus station uphill, if you go in direction zagreb.
After one and a half hour in the hell-hole we decided to just  start walking and were picked up by 2 Indian guys in a pickup truck right away.

Because the road going west from Grubisno Polje was closed we tried going around to Veliki Grdevac and Daruvar. In hinsight we should have walked the closed road to the junction because we got stuck in the middle of nowhere.
Don't come here. Very little traffic + middle of nowhere. We where kinda lucky to get a ride even though It was in de opposit direction of our planned destination.
Thought this was a good spot to continue further south. It isnt. Taxi took us to the next gas station for free though

Dont stop here, not a lot of traffic, we were going north, packed cars, only place possible to go north bc theres no place on the highway. If you want to go north go across the bridge, theres a good spot there
Waited for like 16-17 hours. Had to sleep there. Wanted to go to dubrovnik but everyone is going to Split. Nice workers tho they gave us food
